meanings.definition: To differentiate excessively or excessively specialized.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overdifferentiate between similar shades of blue.
meanings.sent2: He always overdifferentiates when organizing his book collection.
meanings.sent3: The chef's overdifferentiation of ingredients led to a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her overdifferentiation of tasks made her the most efficient team member.
meanings.sent5: The artist's overdifferentiation of colors created a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of making something different or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The overdifferentiation of flavors in the dish made it hard to identify individual tastes.
meanings.sent2: In biology, overdifferentiation can sometimes lead to unnecessary complexity.
meanings.sent3: The overdifferentiation of characters in the play added a comedic twist.
meanings.sent4: The overdifferentiation of responsibilities in the team caused confusion.
meanings.sent5: The overdifferentiation of patterns in the fabric made it stand out from the rest.
